bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Margery Ryerson (1886-1989) graduated from Vassar College in 1909. She went on to study painting with Charles Hawthorne at the Cape School of Art in Provincetown, MA, and with Robert Henri at the Art Students League in New York City. In addition to working as an artist, Ryerson taught art in New York settlement houses. In 1923 she published The Art Spirit on the teachings of Robert Henri. As an artist, Ryerson excelled at portraiture, particulary of children, several of her images of which were used by the United Nations Children’s Fund to illustrate stamps and greeting cards.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: This collection consists of correspondence, class notes, printed material and realia documenting the student years of Margery Ryerson at Vassar College and her involvement in subsequent alumnae events. Of particular interest are the letters and cards Ryerson sent while at Vassar, items which help to document student life at women's colleges in the United States during the early 20th century.
